    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field get(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                          java.lang.String name,
                                          boolean declared)
                                   throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                          java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Gets the field with the provided name from the provided class.

        Parameters:
        clazz - Class that holds the field
        name - Name of the field
        declared - Whether the desired field is declared or not
        Returns:
        Field object of the provided class specified by name
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if a field with the specified name is not found.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager, s, is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as the class loader of this class and invocation of s.checkPermission method with RuntimePermission("accessDeclaredMembers") denies access to the declared field
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class

      • get

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field get(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                          java.lang.String name)
                                   throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                          java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Gets the field with the provided name from the provided class. (No matter if declared or not).

        Parameters:
        clazz - Class that holds the field
        name - Name of the field
        Returns:
        Field object of the provided class specified by name
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if a field with the specified name is not found
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager, s, is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as the class loader of this class and invocation of s.checkPermission method with RuntimePermission("accessDeclaredMembers") denies access to the declared field
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class
        See Also:
        get(Class, String, boolean)

      • getAccessible

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getAccessible(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                    java.lang.String name,
                                                    boolean declared)
                                             throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                    java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Gets the field with the provided name from the provided class, and sets it accessible.

        Parameters:
        clazz - Class that holds the field
        name - Name of the field
        declared - Whether the desired field is declared or not
        Returns:
        Field object of the provided class specified by name
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if a field with the specified name is not found
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager, s, is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as the class loader of this class and invocation of s.checkPermission method with RuntimePermission("accessDeclaredMembers") denies access to the declared field
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class
        • the field cannot be made accessible.

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getAccessible(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,

        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class

      • getValue

        public static <T> T getValue(java.lang.Object object,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             boolean declared)
                      throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                             java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Returns the value of the field represented by the field with the provided name, on the specified object. The value is automatically wrapped in an object if it has a primitive type.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the object to return
        Parameters:
        object - Object from which the represented field's value is to be extracted
        name - Name of the field to get
        declared - Whether the field is declared or not
        Returns:
        Value of the field
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if a field with the specified name is not found
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified object is not an instance of the class or interface declaring the underlying field (or a subclass or implementor thereof).
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the field is completely inaccessible.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager, s, is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as the class loader of this class and invocation of s.checkPermission method with RuntimePermission("accessDeclaredMembers") denies access to the declared field
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class
        • the field cannot be made accessible.
        See Also:
        Field.get(Object)

      • getValue

        public static <T> T getValue(java.lang.Object object,
                             java.lang.String name)
                      throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                             java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Returns the value of the field represented by the field with the provided name (No matter if declared or not), on the specified object. The value is automatically wrapped in an object if it has a primitive type.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the object to return
        Parameters:
        object - Object from which the represented field's value is to be extracted
        name - Name of the field to get
        Returns:
        Value of the field
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if a field with the specified name is not found
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified object is not an instance of the class or interface declaring the underlying field (or a subclass or implementor thereof).
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the field is completely inaccessible.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager, s, is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as the class loader of this class and invocation of s.checkPermission method with RuntimePermission("accessDeclaredMembers") denies access to the declared field
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class
        • the field cannot be made accessible.
        See Also:
        getValue(Object, String, boolean)

      • setValue

        public static java.lang.Object setValue(java.lang.Object object,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        boolean declared,
                                        java.lang.Object value)
                                 throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the field represented by the field with the provided name, on the specified object argument to the specified new value. The new value is automatically unwrapped if the underlying field has a primitive type.

        Parameters:
        object - Object whose field should be modified
        name - Name of the field to set
        declared - Whether the field is declared or not
        value - New value for the field of object being modified
        Returns:
        Same Object, for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if a field with the specified name is not found
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the field is completely inaccessible
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager, s, is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as the class loader of this class and invocation of s.checkPermission method with RuntimePermission("accessDeclaredMembers") denies access to the declared field
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class
        • the field cannot be made accessible.
        See Also:
        Field.set(Object, Object)

      • setValue

        public static java.lang.Object setValue(java.lang.Object object,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.Object value)
                                 throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                                        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the field represented by the field with the provided name (No matter if declared or not), on the specified object argument to the specified new value. The new value is automatically unwrapped if the underlying field has a primitive type.

        Parameters:
        object - Object whose field should be modified
        name - Name of the field to set
        value - New value for the field of object being modified
        Returns:
        Same Object, for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if a field with the specified name is not found
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the field is completely inaccessible
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager, s, is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as the class loader of this class and invocation of s.checkPermission method with RuntimePermission("accessDeclaredMembers") denies access to the declared field
        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class
        • the field cannot be made accessible.
        See Also:
        Field.set(Object, Object)

      • setAccessible

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field setAccessible(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                                    boolean accessible)
                                             throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Sets the provided field as accessible/inaccessible.

        Note that the if the field is final, it will set as "not final", so that the value can be changed.

        Parameters:
        field - Field to set
        accessible - Whether or not the field is accessible
        Returns:
        Same Object, for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the request is denied

      • setAccessible

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field setAccessible(java.lang.reflect.Field field)
                                             throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                                    java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                    java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sets the provided field as accessible.

        Note that the if the field is final, it will set as "not final", so that the value can be changed.

        Parameters:
        field - Field to set
        Returns:
        Same Object, for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the request is denied
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        See Also:
        setAccessible(Field, boolean)

      • getParameterizedTypesClasses

        public static java.lang.Class<?>[] getParameterizedTypesClasses(java.lang.reflect.Field field)
        Returns the classes of the types of a parameterized field, like Collection or Map.

        Examples: - getParameterizedTypesClasses(Collection<Integer>) (of a collection field in this case) will return: [java.lang.Integer] - getParameterizedTypesClasses(Map<Integer, String>) (of a map field in this case) will return: [java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String]

        Parameters:
        field - Parameterized field
        Returns:
        Classes of the types of a parameterized field
